results.title: Magic Flute
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb and Gayle Thomas
results.brief_description: Lyrical animation of the magical events which occur when various children play a flute, evoking both pleasant scenes of flowers and unpleasant ones of witches and bats, according to the personality of the child. Sound film without words. (Awards: Palo Alto; Columbus)

results.title: Magic fibre
results.creator_credit: Aranda Films, Australian Wool Corporation and Bruce McNaughton
results.brief_description: Wool from the sheep’s back to the finished market product. Shows shearing, sorting, testing, classifying, buyers, cleaning, carding, spinning, knitting and weaving. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Magic canvas
results.brief_description: An experiment in the use of the animated cartoon as a new art medium employing to best advantage movement, color and music to convey the ideas of the artists. No narration, music only.

results.title: Maggie Kuhn: wrinkled radical

results.brief_description: Maggie Kuhn who helped establish the Gray Panter Movement in America discusses aspects of old age, human sexuality and medical care. Interviewed by Studs Terkel.

results.title: Magdalena Abakanowicz workshop, Cell Block Theatre, Sydney
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Christopher McGill
results.brief_description: At her four day workshop in Sydney’s Cell Block Theatre in 1976, Magdalena tries to draw the students’ attention to problems like shape, scale, tension between forms space and light. The workshop is shown in progress in four stages of development. Narration by Anne Haddy.
results.title_for_label: Magdalena Abakanowicz workshop, Cell Block Theatre, Sydney

results.title: Maestro
results.creator_credit: Open Training and Education Network, Martin Didsbury and Mark Hughes
results.brief_description: Presented by Andrea Stretton of SBS’s “The Book Show”, this video features dramatised excerpts from the novel, “Maestro”, and studio discussions with it’s author (Peter Goldsworthy) and an English teacher. Together, they explore the importance of personal response to the novel, how to establish a personal response, and how to give the ensuing personal response.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Open Training and Education Network, Martin Didsbury and Mark Hughes

results.title: Madurai of the Naiks
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, Jehangir Bhownagary and Jagat Murari
results.brief_description: The Hindu shrines in Madurai, built in the 16th to 18th centuries by the Naik rulers. The Hindu mythology recounted in the multitudinous carvings and frescoes in the temple halls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Documentary Films of India, Jehangir Bhownagary and Jagat Murari

results.title: Madrid: capital de Espana
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Egons Tomsons
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film for first year Spanish students. Views of Madrid, Spain: the principle streets, the airport, Spain’s tallest building, monuments and statues, the bull ring and bullfight. Visits the Prado Museum featuring paintings by El Greco, Goya and Velasquez. Narration by Juan Manuel Garcia.
results.description: A Spanish language film for first year Spanish students. results.title: Madras Kanchi
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, Ezra Mir and M Krishnaswamy
results.brief_description: The harbour city of Madras and the ancient towns of Kanchi and Mahibalipuram nearby. The history of Madras, its public buildings, crafts, Museum and National Gallery with sculptures and archaeological remains from Dravidian times; the Theosophical Society; music and dancing; Kanchi, one of the seven sacred cities, its masterweavers, its temples with frescoes and sculptures dating from the 8th century A.D.; Mahibalipuram with temples and sculptures cut from solid rock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Films Division, Government of India, Ezra Mir and M Krishnaswamy
